Title: IT Project Manager- Technical
Job_Description:
IT Project Manager- Technical
PBF Energy Inc. (NYSE:PBF) is one of the largest independent refiners in North America, operating through its subsidiaries, oil refineries and related facilities. PBF Energy has an immediate need at our company headquarters located in Parsippany, NJ for a talented IT solutions professional to lead IT related Projects.
This position provides Project Management expertise for IT Projects. This includes development and management of a project plan, ongoing management of project issues and risks, status reporting and presentations, managing the implementation of solutions throughout all phases of the project, and leading coordination between multiple IT and Business groups.
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES
Ability to manage projects from definition of project scope through implementation
Manage timeline, resources, and budget

Title: Electrical Engineer
Job_Description:
Electrical Engineer

PBF Energy Inc. (NYSE:PBF) is one of the largest independent refiners in North America, operating, through its subsidiaries, oil refineries and related facilities. We are a growing organization seeking a talented Electrical Engineer to join our team as a pivotal member here at PBF Energy. This role is located at Torrance Refining Company in Torrance, CA.
JOB SUMMARY
The Electrical Engineer provides leadership, technical expertise and business perspective in all areas related to the plant's electrical systems. This position is responsible for preventative maintenance programs, coordination of improvement and new projects and cost/budget management. Electrical Engineer works with operating and maintenance teams to drive continuous improvement and reliability of electrical components, equipment and systems. Electrical Engineers may also have instrumentation related responsibilities.
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Title: Electrical Engineer
Job_Description:
Process Control Engineer
Primary responsibilities to support Operations & Maintenance of the running plant Basic Process Control Systems (BPCS) and Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS). Spans installations & reliability improvements, modernizations, and Capital projects. Supports all phases of applied systems - initial scope, design & review, procurement, field construction, field assessments, final execution, and maintenance in perpetuity. Process Control Engineer acts as an instrumentation/controls expert with Process & Operations acumen to lead and coordinate refinery & power plant applications which employ new capital installations for plant adaptation across all disciplines â€“ typically HSE/PSM/ENV, O&M, and ProcEng. Knowledge depth covers process instrumentation wetted parts, field devices and signal transport to marshaling, ICS termination assemblies, logic solvers, servers (and thin-clients), workstations, Operator console, fault-tolerant Ethernet (FTE) network switches.
The primary duty of an Instrumentation & Process Control Engineer is to develop, design, implement, configure, and support basic & advanced process controls on all control system platforms as well as the instrumentation from measurement to field relays, logic solvers, and final elements. This includes supporting continuous and batch control applications based on the varied vintages of Distributed Control Systems (DCS), Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), multivariable applications on-platform and off-platform. This position is part of the Technical Department and will report to the Instrumentation & Control Engineering Manager.
Primary Functions
o Regularly apply and conversant in SIS, DCS, and advanced engineering applications. Platform examples are Foxboro DCS, Honeywell DCS TDC to Experion, Triconex SIS, GE Mark V+. Application examples are sequence of event reporting, abnormal event detection/real time advisory alerting, alarm management strategies, control performance monitoring/improvements, blending optimization
o Develop and provide support for basic process control applications using process engineering principles collaborated with Process Engineers, translated to control applications for IO configuration, control model development, simulated loop tuning, control logic build/test, identification of process dynamics, Console Operator interfaces
o Maintain and modify existing process control applications and Console Operator interfaces following established standards.
o Identify and develop new control schemes and required field instrumentation to increase process safety, optimization, and reliability.
o Provide process control support during project development, execution, and startup.
o Respond to plant operational events and support planned & unplanned unit outages/turnarounds.
o Identify measurement & control requirements then specify instrumentation to meet them following industry & site-specific standards API, ISA, NFPA, NEC, IEEE, ASME, ANSI, ASCE
o Assemble estimates and installation scopes with piping & process details. Follow installation to field to learn and improve the scope development process
o Communicate and interact regularly with Operations, Technical, Inspection, Health Safety & Environmental, Maintenance, and Business Teams.

Job Qualifications:
o BS in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering, equivalent degree, or work experience required.
o 10+ years in depth work experience in a manufacturing/operating environment.
o Prefer professional experience (including internships and co-ops) in the chemical/petrochemical, oil, or gas industries.
o Familiarity with real-time computing systems/tools, Industrial Control Systems, and engineering applications
o Demonstrated experience or essential understanding of regulatory and advanced controls of manufacturing processes.
o Knowledge of field devices, instrument specification requirements, process interface limitations, signal transport / marshalling / final tie-in to various logic solvers
o Able to demonstrate initiative, accuracy, effectiveness, and strong written & verbal communication skills.
o Excellent troubleshooting skills.
Core Competencies & Characteristics:
o Proactively and constructively pursues improvement
o Values teamwork and acts as a team player
o Maintains high ethical standards while remaining results focused
o Demonstrates and accepts ownership for quality of work
o Applies measured risk approach and risk-value analysis methods for all business decisions
o Sets high standards for safety, integrity, and operational excellence
o Maintains productive and mutually beneficial relationships with business partners, suppliers & peers across departments
o Continually improves functional knowledge and critical working skills
o Effectively uses written and verbal communications to drive desired results
o Flexibility to handle multiple assignments and interact across all levels of the organization
Supervisory Duties:
o Training and mentoring peers and co-ops

Title: Commercial Solutions Business Analyst
Job_Description:
Commercial Solutions Business Analyst
PBF Energy Inc. (NYSE:PBF) is one of the largest independent refiners in North America, operating through its subsidiaries, oil refineries and related facilities. We are seeking a talented Commercial Solutions Business Analyst to join our team as a pivotal member that would play a key role here at PBF Energy. This role would be located onsite at our Company headquarters in Parsippany, NJ.
The Business Analyst will maximize usage of existing tools by business function. Ensure appropriate leveraging of potential alternative tools to address business functional requirements. Assist business function resources with determining appropriate strategic direction for functionalities and tools (e.g., tool upgrade, modification, or change). Provide application support to the systems associated with defined business function(s) within consistent standard business operating practices.
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES
